net.wstech2.me.httpsclient

Interface CertificateErrorHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultCertificateErrorHandler

    public interface CertificateErrorHandler
    Defines a callback method to be invoke when the certificate sent by the server is determined to be invalid, i.e.:
    - the public key correspondent to the C.A.'s PK used to sign the certificate could not be found. See ERROR_CA_CERTIFICATE_NOT_FOUND;
    - the certificate's start or end dates are, respectively, after or before the current date. See ERROR_INVALID_START_DATE and ERROR_INVALID_END_DATE;
    - the certificate's common name value does not match the server's host name. See ERROR_INVALID_COMMON_NAME;
    - the certificate's extended key usage attribute does not contain the server authentication usage type. See CERTIFICATE_INVALID_FOR_SERVER_AUTHENTICATION.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CERTIFICATE_INVALID_FOR_SERVER_AUTHENTICATION
      OID "1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1" was not found among the certificate's extended key usage attributes.
      static int ERROR_CA_CERTIFICATE_NOT_FOUND
      It was not possible to find at the device repositories the C.A.
      static int ERROR_INVALID_COMMON_NAME
      The Server certificate's common name and the server's hostname do not match.
      static int ERROR_INVALID_END_DATE
      Certificate's end date is invalid, i.e., before current date.
      static int ERROR_INVALID_START_DATE
      Certificate's start date is invalid, i.e., after current date.
      static int ON_ERROR_ABORT
      Abort the connection.
      static int ON_ERROR_CONTINUE
      Continue even if the certificate has errors.
      static int ON_ERROR_TRY_AGAIN
      Try again to validate the certificate.

      A callback method to be invoke if the certificate sent by the server is determined to be invalid.

      • ERROR_INVALID_COMMON_NAME

        static final int ERROR_INVALID_COMMON_NAME
        The Server certificate's common name and the server's hostname do not match.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_INVALID_START_DATE

        static final int ERROR_INVALID_START_DATE
        Certificate's start date is invalid, i.e., after current date.

        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_INVALID_END_DATE

        static final int ERROR_INVALID_END_DATE
        Certificate's end date is invalid, i.e., before current date.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_CA_CERTIFICATE_NOT_FOUND

        static final int ERROR_CA_CERTIFICATE_NOT_FOUND
        It was not possible to find at the device repositories the C.A. certificate corresponding to the private key used to sign the server certificate.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CERTIFICATE_INVALID_FOR_SERVER_AUTHENTICATION

        static final int CERTIFICATE_INVALID_FOR_SERVER_AUTHENTICATION
        OID "1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1" was not found among the certificate's extended key usage attributes. This OID is used to indicate that the certificate can be used for server authentication.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ON_ERROR_CONTINUE

        static final int ON_ERROR_CONTINUE
        Continue even if the certificate has errors.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ON_ERROR_ABORT

        static final int ON_ERROR_ABORT
        Abort the connection.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ON_ERROR_TRY_AGAIN

        static final int ON_ERROR_TRY_AGAIN
        Try again to validate the certificate. Probably used after the handler added a certificate to the record store.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • onCertificateValidationError

        int onCertificateValidationError(org.bouncycastle.asn1.x509.Certificate cert,
                               int[] errors,
                               HttpsConnectionImpl httpsConnectionInstance,
                               CertificateValidator certificateValidatorInstance)
        A callback method to be invoke if the certificate sent by the server is determined to be invalid.
        Parameters:
        cert - server's certificate.
        errors - an int array containing the IDs corresponding to all errors encountered by certificate validators.
        httpsConnectionInstance - the https connection instance associated with the certificate.
        certificateValidatorInstance - the CertificateValidator instance which performed the server certificate validation.
        Returns:
        - 1: continue even if the certificate contains errors;
        - 2: abort;
        - 3: try again.
